enWisdom: The bane of kings is evil intentions
The bane of viziers is wicked inner thoughts
The bane of leaders is weakness in politics
The bane of the masses is disobedience [to the rightful ruler]
The bane of the strong person is underestimating the enemy
The bane of the just [ones] is lack of piety
The bane of a kingdom is [having] weak defences
The bane of power is withholding favour

Wisdom: الدَّوْلَةُ تَرُدُّ خَطَأَ صَاحِبِهَا صَوَاباً وَصَوَابَ ضِدِّهِ خَطَاءً
enWisdom: Worldly wealth and power turns the mistake of its owner into a proper act and the proper act of his opponent into a mistake

Wisdom: إِذَا زَادَكَ السُّلْطَانُ تَقْرِيباً فَزِدْهُ إِجْلَالًا
enWisdom: When the ruler makes you come closer to him, then increase your exaltation of him

Wisdom: ثَلَاثَةٌ مُهْلِكَةٌ الْجُرْأَةُ عَلَى السُّلْطَانِ وَائْتِمَانُ الْخَوَّانِ وَشُرْبُ السَّمِّ لِلتَّجْرِبَةِ
enWisdom: Three things cause ruin: boldness in front of the ruler, trusting a disloyal person and tasting poison as an experiment [to see how effective it is!]
